moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.tum_vie.reader module

This a reader for the TUM dataset.

class moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.tum_vie.reader.TumVieReader(regime: TimeLimit | Stream, dataset_params: TumVieConfig)[source]

Bases: DataReader

__init__(regime: TimeLimit | Stream, dataset_params: TumVieConfig)[source]
Parameters:

  • regime – regime to read the data.

  • dataset_params – dataset parameters.

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – if any required file does not exist.

  • NotADirectoryError – if the dataset directory does not exist.

__enter__()[source]

Opens all files for reading and initializes iterators.

__exit__(exc_type: type[BaseException] | None, exc_val: BaseException | None, exc_tb: TracebackType | None)[source]

Closes all opened files.

set_initial_state(sensor: Sensor, timestamp: int) → None[source]

Sets the iterator position for the given sensor and timestamp.

Parameters:

  • sensor – sensor to set the iterator position.

  • timestamp – timestamp to set the iterator position.

Raises:

  • RuntimeError – if the method is called outside the context manager.

  • ItemNotFoundError – if no measurement found for the sensor at the given timestamp.

moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.tum_vie.utils.create_sequence(files: dict[str, Path], regime: TimeLimit | Stream, used_sensors: set[str]) → tuple[list[tuple[int, str, int]], dict[str, int]][source]

Create a list of tuples containing the timestamp, sensor name and index.

Parameters:

  • files – dict with sensor names and file paths.

  • regime – a TimeLimit or Stream object.

  • used_sensors – a set of sensor names to be used.

Returns:

a list of tuples containing the timestamp, sensor name and index.

sensor indices: a dictionary of sensor name <-> index pairs.

Return type:

elements

Creates a list of tuples containing the timestamp, sensor name and index for the TimeLimit regime.

  • used_sensors – a set of sensor names to be used.

  • start – start timestamp.

  • stop – stop timestamp.
